podDisruptionBudget.title: podDisruptionBudget

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account.
annotations.title: annotations

automount.title: automount

extraLabels.title: extraLabels

The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template.
name.title: name

commonLabels.description: Additional labels added to all helm chart resources.
commonLabels.title: commonLabels

concurrent.description:
Specifies the number of concurrent ExternalSecret Reconciles external-secret executes at
a time.
concurrent.title: concurrent

controllerClass.description:
If set external secrets will filter matching
Secret Stores with the appropriate controller values.
controllerClass.title: controllerClass

enabled.description: Conversion is disabled by default as we stopped supporting v1alpha1.
enabled.title: enabled

createClusterExternalSecret.description: If true, create CRDs for Cluster External Secret.
createClusterExternalSecret.title: createClusterExternalSecret

createClusterGenerator.description: If true, create CRDs for Cluster Generator.
createClusterGenerator.title: createClusterGenerator

createClusterPushSecret.description: If true, create CRDs for Cluster Push Secret.
createClusterPushSecret.title: createClusterPushSecret

createClusterSecretStore.description: If true, create CRDs for Cluster Secret Store.
createClusterSecretStore.title: createClusterSecretStore

createPushSecret.description: If true, create CRDs for Push Secret.
createPushSecret.title: createPushSecret

createOperator.description: Specifies whether an external secret operator deployment be created.
createOperator.title: createOperator

enableHTTP2.description: if true, HTTP2 will be enabled for the services created by all controllers, curently metrics and webhook.
enableHTTP2.title: enableHTTP2

extendedMetricLabels.description:
If true external secrets will use recommended kubernetes
annotations as prometheus metric labels.
extendedMetricLabels.title: extendedMetricLabels

extraArgs.title: extraArgs

extraContainers.description: # -- Extra containers to add to the pod.
extraContainers.title: extraContainers

extraEnv.title: extraEnv

extraInitContainers.title: extraInitContainers

extraObjects.description: # -- Extra Kubernetes objects to deploy with the helm chart
extraObjects.title: extraObjects

extraVolumeMounts.description: # -- Extra volumes to mount to the container.
extraVolumeMounts.title: extraVolumeMounts

extraVolumes.description: # -- Extra volumes to pass to pod.
extraVolumes.title: extraVolumes

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.

adaptSecurityContext.description:
Manages the securityContext properties to make them compatible with OpenShift.
Possible values:
auto - Apply configurations if it is detected that OpenShift is the target platform.
force - Always apply configurations.
disabled - No modification applied.
adaptSecurityContext.title: adaptSecurityContext

global.title: global

annotations.description:
Annotations that ConfigMaps can have to get configured in Grafana,
See: sidecar.dashboards.folderAnnotation for specifying the dashboard folder.
https://github.com/grafana/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/grafana
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: If true creates a Grafana dashboard.
enabled.title: enabled

extraLabels.description: Extra labels to add to the Grafana dashboard ConfigMap.
extraLabels.title: extraLabels

sidecarLabel.description: Label that ConfigMaps should have to be loaded as dashboards.
sidecarLabel.title: sidecarLabel

sidecarLabelValue.description: Label value that ConfigMaps should have to be loaded as dashboards.
sidecarLabelValue.title: sidecarLabelValue

hostNetwork.description: Run the controller on the host network
hostNetwork.title: hostNetwork

flavour.description:
The flavour of tag you want to use
There are different image flavours available, like distroless and ubi.
Please see GitHub release notes for image tags for these flavors.
By default, the distroless image is used.
flavour.title: flavour

tag.description: The image tag to use. The default is the chart appVersion.
tag.title: tag

installCRDs.description: If set, install and upgrade CRDs through helm chart.
installCRDs.title: installCRDs

leaderElect.description:
If true, external-secrets will perform leader election between instances to ensure no more
than one instance of external-secrets operates at a time.
leaderElect.title: leaderElect

enabled.description: Enabled determines if the liveness probe should be used or not. By default it's disabled.
enabled.title: enabled

failureThreshold.description: Number of consecutive probe failures that should occur before considering the probe as failed.
failureThreshold.title: failureThreshold

port.description: Set this value to 8082 to active liveness probes.
port.title: port

initialDelaySeconds.description: Delay in seconds for the container to start before performing the initial probe.
initialDelaySeconds.title: initialDelaySeconds

periodSeconds.description: Period in seconds for K8s to start performing probes.
periodSeconds.title: periodSeconds

successThreshold.description: Number of successful probes to mark probe successful.
successThreshold.title: successThreshold

timeoutSeconds.description: Specify the maximum amount of time to wait for a probe to respond before considering it fails.
timeoutSeconds.title: timeoutSeconds

log.description: Specifies Log Params to the External Secrets Operator
log.title: log

certDir.description:
if those are not set or invalid, self-signed certs will be generated
TLS cert directory path
certDir.title: certDir

enabled.description: Enable if you use another monitoring tool than Prometheus to scrape the metrics
enabled.title: enabled

openshiftFinalizers.description: If true the OpenShift finalizer permissions will be added to RBAC
openshiftFinalizers.title: openshiftFinalizers

podDisruptionBudget.description: Pod disruption budget - for more details see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/disruptions/
podDisruptionBudget.title: podDisruptionBudget

podSpecExtra.description: Any extra pod spec on the deployment
podSpecExtra.title: podSpecExtra

processClusterExternalSecret.description:
if true, the operator will process cluster external secret. Else, it will ignore them.
When enabled, this adds update/patch permissions on namespaces to handle finalizers for proper
cleanup during namespace deletion, preventing race conditions with ExternalSecrets.
processClusterExternalSecret.title: processClusterExternalSecret

processClusterGenerator.description: if true, the operator will process cluster generator. Else, it will ignore them.
processClusterGenerator.title: processClusterGenerator

processClusterPushSecret.description: if true, the operator will process cluster push secret. Else, it will ignore them.
processClusterPushSecret.title: processClusterPushSecret

processClusterStore.description: if true, the operator will process cluster store. Else, it will ignore them.
processClusterStore.title: processClusterStore

processPushSecret.description: if true, the operator will process push secret. Else, it will ignore them.
processPushSecret.title: processPushSecret

aggregateToEdit.description: Specifies whether permissions are aggregated to the edit ClusterRole
aggregateToEdit.title: aggregateToEdit

aggregateToView.description: Specifies whether permissions are aggregated to the view ClusterRole
aggregateToView.title: aggregateToView

create.description: Specifies whether role and rolebinding resources should be created.
create.title: create

create.description: Specifies whether a clusterrole to give servicebindings read access should be created.
create.title: create

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Specifies the amount of historic ReplicaSets k8s should keep (see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/#clean-up-policy)
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

scopedNamespace.description:
If set external secrets are only reconciled in the
provided namespace
scopedNamespace.title: scopedNamespace

scopedRBAC.description:
Must be used with scopedNamespace. If true, create scoped RBAC roles under the scoped namespace
and implicitly disable cluster stores and cluster external secrets
scopedRBAC.title: scopedRBAC

ipFamilies.description: Sets the families that should be supported and the order in which they should be applied to ClusterIP as well. Can be IPv4 and/or IPv6.
ipFamilies.title: ipFamilies

ipFamilyPolicy.description: Set the ip family policy to configure dual-stack see [Configure dual-stack](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/dual-stack/#services)
ipFamilyPolicy.title: ipFamilyPolicy

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account.
annotations.title: annotations

automount.description: Automounts the service account token in all containers of the pod
automount.title: automount

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created.
create.title: create

extraLabels.description: Extra Labels to add to the service account.
extraLabels.title: extraLabels

name.description:
The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template.
name.title: name

enabled.description: Specifies whether to create a ServiceMonitor resource for collecting Prometheus metrics
enabled.title: enabled

honorLabels.description: Let prometheus add an exported_ prefix to conflicting labels
honorLabels.title: honorLabels

metricRelabelings.description: Metric relabel configs to apply to samples before ingestion. [Metric Relabeling](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#metric_relabel_configs)
metricRelabelings.title: metricRelabelings

namespace.description: namespace where you want to install ServiceMonitors
namespace.title: namespace

relabelings.description: Relabel configs to apply to samples before ingestion. [Relabeling](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#relabel_config)
relabelings.title: relabelings

scrapeTimeout.description: Timeout if metrics can't be retrieved in given time interval
scrapeTimeout.title: scrapeTimeout

systemAuthDelegator.description: If true the system:auth-delegator ClusterRole will be added to RBAC
systemAuthDelegator.title: systemAuthDelegator

annotations.description: Annotations to place on validating webhook configuration.
annotations.title: annotations

certCheckInterval.description: Specifies the time to check if the cert is valid
certCheckInterval.title: certCheckInterval

addInjectorAnnotations.description:
Automatically add the cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from annotation to the
webhooks and CRDs. As long as you have the cert-manager CA Injector
enabled, this will automatically setup your webhook's CA to the one used
by cert-manager. See https://cert-manager.io/docs/concepts/ca-injector
addInjectorAnnotations.title: addInjectorAnnotations

annotations.description: Add extra annotations to the Certificate resource.
annotations.title: annotations

create.description:
Create a certificate resource within this chart. See
https://cert-manager.io/docs/usage/certificate/
create.title: create

duration.description:
Set the requested duration (i.e. lifetime) of the Certificate. See
https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io/v1.CertificateSpec
One year by default.
duration.title: duration

issuerRef.description:
For the Certificate created by this chart, setup the issuer. See
https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io/v1.IssuerSpec
issuerRef.title: issuerRef

renewBefore.description:
How long before the currently issued certificates expiry
cert-manager should renew the certificate. See
https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io/v1.CertificateSpec
Note that renewBefore should be greater than .webhook.lookaheadInterval
since the webhook will check this far in advance that the certificate is
valid.
renewBefore.title: renewBefore

revisionHistoryLimit.description:
Set the revisionHistoryLimit on the Certificate. See
https://cert-manager.io/docs/reference/api-docs/#cert-manager.io/v1.CertificateSpec
Defaults to 0 (ignored).
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

enabled.description:
Enabling cert-manager support will disable the built in secret and
switch to using cert-manager (installed separately) to automatically issue
and renew the webhook certificate. This chart does not install
cert-manager for you, See https://cert-manager.io/docs/
enabled.title: enabled

create.description: Specifies whether a webhook deployment be created. If set to false, crds.conversion.enabled should also be set to false otherwise the kubeapi will be hammered because the conversion is looking for a webhook endpoint.
create.title: create

extraArgs.description: # -- Map of extra arguments to pass to container.
extraArgs.title: extraArgs

extraInitContainers.description: # -- Extra init containers to add to the pod.
extraInitContainers.title: extraInitContainers

extraVolumeMounts.description: # -- Extra volumes to mount to the container.
extraVolumeMounts.title: extraVolumeMounts

extraVolumes.description: # -- Extra volumes to pass to pod.
extraVolumes.title: extraVolumes

failurePolicy.description: Specifies whether validating webhooks should be created with failurePolicy: Fail or Ignore
failurePolicy.title: failurePolicy

hostNetwork.description: Specifies if webhook pod should use hostNetwork or not.
hostNetwork.title: hostNetwork

flavour.description: The flavour of tag you want to use
flavour.title: flavour

tag.description: The image tag to use. The default is the chart appVersion.
tag.title: tag

log.description: Specifies Log Params to the Webhook
log.title: log

lookaheadInterval.description: Specifies the lookaheadInterval for certificate validity
lookaheadInterval.title: lookaheadInterval

enabled.description: Enable if you use another monitoring tool than Prometheus to scrape the metrics
enabled.title: enabled

podDisruptionBudget.description: Pod disruption budget - for more details see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/disruptions/
podDisruptionBudget.title: podDisruptionBudget

port.description: The port the webhook will listen to
port.title: port

create.description: Specifies whether role and rolebinding resources should be created.
create.title: create

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Specifies the amount of historic ReplicaSets k8s should keep (see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/#clean-up-policy)
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

service.description: Manage the service through which the webhook is reached.

annotations.description: Custom annotations for the webhook service.
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: Whether the service object should be enabled or not (it is expected to exist).
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description: Custom labels for the webhook service.
labels.title: labels

loadBalancerIP.description:
If the webhook service type is LoadBalancer, you can assign a specific load balancer IP here.
Check the documentation of your load balancer provider to see if/how this should be used.
loadBalancerIP.title: loadBalancerIP

type.description: The service type of the webhook service.
type.title: type

service.title: service

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account.
annotations.title: annotations

automount.description: Automounts the service account token in all containers of the pod
automount.title: automount

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created.
create.title: create

extraLabels.description: Extra Labels to add to the service account.
extraLabels.title: extraLabels

name.description:
The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template.
name.title: name
